Andrew Bassford | honorific_suffix = | native_name = | native_name_lang = | image = | image_size = | alt = | caption = | birth_date = | death_date = | birth_place = | death_place = | placeofburial = | placeofburial_label = | placeofburial_coordinates = | nickname = | birth_name = | allegiance = {{US}} | branch = {{army|US}} | serviceyears = 1986- | rank = [[File:US-O7 insignia.svg|10px]] [[Brigadier general (United States)|Brigadier General]] | servicenumber = | unit = | commands = | battles = | battles_label = | awards = [[Meritorious Service Medal (United States)|Meritorious Service Medal]]
[[Commendation Medal|Army Commendation Medal]]
[[Achievement Medal|Army Achievement Medal]] | memorials = | spouse = | relations = | laterwork = | signature = | website = | module = }} '''R. Andrew Bassford''' is a [[Brigadier general (United States)|brigadier general]] in the [[United States Army Reserve]] and Deputy Commander of the 88th Regional Support Command at [[Fort McCoy, Wisconsin]]. ==Career== Bassford originally joined the [[United States Army]] in 1986.{{cite web|url=http://www.usar.army.mil/ourstory/leadership/Pages/Bassford.aspx|title=Brig. Gen. R. A. Bassford|publisher=United States Army Reserve|accessdate=2014-05-20}} The following year, he completed the Basic, Airborne and Ranger Courses at the [[United States Army Infantry School]] and was assigned to the [[7th Infantry Division (United States)|7th Infantry Division]] in [[Germany]]. Later, he joined the [[325th Infantry Regiment (United States)|325th Airborne Infantry Regiment]]. In 1998, Bassford transferred to the Army Reserve and was assigned to the [[80th Division (United States)|80th Division]]. Later, he became a battalion commander with the [[317th Infantry Regiment (United States)|317th Infantry Regiment]] and a brigade commander with the [[98th Division (United States)|98th Division]]. In 2013, Bassford was Chief of Staff of the [[108th Training Command (Initial Entry Training)]]. He was promoted to the rank of brigadier general in 2014.{{cite web|url=http://www.army.mil/article/121731/88th_RSC_deputy_commanding_general_promoted_to_brigadier_general/|title=88th RSC deputy commanding general promoted to brigadier general|publisher=United States Army|accessdate=2014-05-20}} Awards he has received include the [[Meritorious Service Medal (United States)|Meritorious Service Medal]], the [[Commendation Medal|Army Commendation Medal]] and the [[Achievement Medal|Army Achievement Medal]]. In addition, he is authorized to wear the [[Ranger tab]], the [[Parachutist Badge (United States)|Senior Parachutist Badge]] and the [[Expert Infantryman Badge]]. ==Education== *[[Georgetown University]] *[[University of Virginia School of Law]] *United States Army Infantry School *[[United States Army War College]] *[[United States Army Jumpmaster School]] *[[United States Army Command and General Staff College]] ==References== {{reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Bassford, R}} [[Category:United States Army generals]] [[Category:United States Army Rangers]] [[Category:United States Army reservists]] [[Category:Georgetown University alumni]] [[Category:University of Virginia School of Law alumni]] [[Category:United States Army War College alumni]] [[Category:United States Army Command and General Staff College alumni]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Year of birth missing (living people)]]
